intro: Gymnadenia × bornmuelleri, commonly known as the hybrid grass of the genus Gymnadenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a variety of morphological traits that distinguish it from its parent species.
